context.p: If you want to execute test suites or test suite collections in private domains with TestCloud, you must use TestCloud Tunnel.
For more information on TestCloud Tunnel, see TestCloud Tunnel.

ul.li: To allow User Datagram Protocol (UDP) connections, the proxy must be configured.
If you use a Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) proxy, it must be configured to allow Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections.

context.p: In , TestCloud Tunnel can be configured with Tunnel Setup Helper.

step.info: You'll see a message in red, as follows:Katalon Studio - TestCloud Configuration dialog, TestCloud Tunnel not available status

step.cmd: Click the Tunnel Setup Helper link.

info.p: The Tunnel Setup Helper dialog appears.Katalon Studio - Tunnel Setup Helper dialog

step.cmd: Follow the step-by-step instructions in the dialog to set up the tunnel client in your local machine:

substep.cmd: Select your OS and download the .zip file, then unzip it.
Open the command-line interface (CLI) and navigate to the directory containing the TC-tunnel executable file. Copy the command line from the dialog, then run it in the CLI.
substep.info: An example command looks like this:/Applications/kt config --tenant KatalonStudio --username "myusername@katalon.com" --organization-id "myid" --api-key "myapikey"

substep.cmd: Use the kt start command to start the tunnel.

image.alt: Sample terminal message for running TestCloud Tunnel

note.p: Keep your CLI open until you have finished running tests.

step.cmd: Switch back to Tunnel Setup Helper and click Close.
step.info: Click Refresh and you can see the available status.Katalon Studio - TestCloud Configuration dialog - TestCloud Tunnel available

step.cmd: Click Run to start executing your test suite/test suite collection with TestCloud Tunnel.
